My new commute is about 15 miles each way, much of it on steady inclines with one short but punchy climb. I'd like to stop worrying about charging every night, since I typically ride five days a week and sometimes add errands after work. On weekends I explore gravel greenways and sandy trails which get slushy in winter. I want something that keeps a predictable pace on flats, helps maintain speed into headwinds without a jerky on-off feel, and still feels planted when the surface gets loose. Braking should stay strong and consistent in rain. I often finish rides at dusk on unlit paths, and having bright built-in lighting that can use around the bike is a genuine plus.

Comfort on longer rides matters and I don't want an overkill downhill or heavy-duty mountain machine — just a capable, reliable option that covers your commute and occasional trail rides.
